playlists.name: What does not quite FULL feel like?

inputs.label: Resting heart rate

tasks.name: Hunger Hack
tasks.desc: To feel less hungry, have something small to eat 20 minutes before your meal- like a cup of broth or a few brazil nuts and tea. Or even half a teaspoon of peanut butter with a glass of water.

inputs.label: What does "almost full" feel like?
What does "full" feel like?
Did you stop at "almost full" or keep going?
Did you eat past "full"? A little? A lot?
Would you resize your portions to make it easier to hit “almost full” for your next main meal?
How do you feel? Hungry? Stuffed? Comfortable?
When did you start to feel hungry again?
What does "almost full" feel like?
What does "full" feel like?
Did you stop at "almost full" or keep going?
Did you eat past "full"? A little? A lot?
Would you resize your portions to make it easier to hit “almost full” for your next main meal?
How do you feel? Hungry? Stuffed? Comfortable?
When did you start to feel hungry again?

tasks.name: Try to Stop Eating Before Full
tasks.desc: Try to STOP eating for at least five minutes at largest meal of the day when feeling “80%” or “almost” full

How does it feel to stop eating at "almost full"?
How might you change the amount of food on your plate to maintain "almost full" for another week?
Would you like to try this practice for another week?
Did you try the "have something small 20 minutes before the meal"? If so, did you feel satisfied / less hungry sooner during your meal? Did you feel less hungry for longer after your meal?

tasks.name: PREP for Week 2
tasks.desc:
Gather greens and reds for Week 2. Greens are veggies, reds are proteins.
The aim for the coming week is to re-think carb-oriented meals to be green and red for one week and to eat carbs only after the green/red components.
